paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: varied, specific ages and sexes not detailed

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed at age 32 and presented with sensorimotor neuropathy.
Patient P2 was diagnosed at age 37 and exhibited autonomic neuropathy.
Patient P3 was evaluated at age 42 and reported no symptoms.

functional_data.summary: Functional assays indicated that the p.Met40Val variant leads to abnormal protein aggregation.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is commonly associated with TTR-FAP in European populations.
key_quotes: The most common mutation type is the methionine-for-valine substitution at position 30 (Val30Met).
Despite being a severe, rare disease with an established hereditary origin, there remains little guidance surrounding early monitoring and diagnosis of asymptomatic carriers.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted from the main text, with specific attention to penetrance and individual records.
